We’ve noticed that when making small adjustments to the robot’s position by driving the robot, the drive motors run before the steer motors rotate the wheels. This can cause the robot to back off a wall about 1-2\" when bumpered up and trying to strafe sideways slightly. Are there any specific areas we need to look to tune this?
